desc: Model deployment, monitoring, and production best practices
name: MLOps & Production

note_models.name: ML Interview Card

fields: What is data drift and concept drift? How do you detect them?

Data drift: Input feature distribution changes over time
Concept drift: Relationship between features and target changes
Detection: Statistical tests, model performance monitoring
Solutions: Retraining, adaptive models, ensemble methods
What are the key considerations for model deployment?

Latency: Real-time vs batch inference requirements
Scalability: Handle traffic spikes and growth
Monitoring: Track performance, errors, and data quality
Versioning: Model rollbacks, A/B testing, gradual rollouts
How do you handle model versioning and A/B testing?

Versioning: Track model artifacts, code, data, hyperparameters
A/B testing: Compare model performance with statistical significance
Canary deployment: Gradual rollout to subset of traffic
Blue-green deployment: Switch between old and new models
What is feature store and why is it important?

Purpose: Centralized repository for ML features
Benefits: Feature reuse, consistency, versioning, monitoring
Components: Feature computation, storage, serving, monitoring
Use cases: Real-time features, feature sharing across teams
